intro: Silene smithii, commonly known as Smith's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Silene smithii is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
